intro: Cyperus wilburii, commonly known as the Wilbur flatsedge, is a flowering plant in the sedge family, Cyperaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly found in wetland and marshy habitats. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower heads that are typically green or brown in color. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife species. Cyperus wilburii is a perennial plant that thrives in moist environments and is adapted to periodic flooding.
